title: 103_s382
content: The Emergency Unemployment Compensation Amendments of 1993 extend the program until October 2, 1993, with modifications to the final phase-out dates. The effective date for the amendments is after March 6, 1993. SEC. 3 extends the Emergency Unemployment Compensation Act of 1991 until October 2, 1993, with amended dates for benefits termination. The amendments apply to weeks after March 6, 1993. The Secretary of Labor will establish a program to profile new claimants for unemployment compensation to identify those likely to exhaust benefits and in need of reemployment assistance. Technical assistance will be provided to states in developing profiling systems. The Secretary of Labor will provide technical assistance and funding to states for developing model profiling systems to identify claimants likely to exhaust benefits. A report on the effectiveness of these systems will be submitted to Congress within 30 months. The term "State" in this section refers to the definition in the Internal Revenue Code. The provisions of this section will be effective upon the enactment of this Act. SEC. 5. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Authorized appropriations for non-repayable advances to the account for 'Advances to the Unemployment Trust Fund and Other Funds' in the Department of Labor appropriations Acts (for transfer to the 'extended unemployment compensation account' established by section 905 of the Social Security Act) as necessary to carry out the purposes of the amendments made by section 2 of this Act. Financing provisions. SEC. 5. FINANCING PROVISIONS. Authorization for nonrepayable advances to the account for "Advances to the Unemployment Trust Fund and Other Funds" in Department of Labor Appropriations Acts to make payments to the States for the purposes of the amendments made by section 2 of this Act. Use of Advance Account Funds from the Department of Labor Appropriation Act for Fiscal Year 1993 can be used for the same purposes. SEC. 6. EMERGENCY DESIGNATION. Congress designates all direct spending amounts and appropriations provided by this Act for all fiscal years as emergency requirements under the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985.
